node.label: Academic freedom
node.hasNote: Liberty of educational institutions to decide courses and research, and of teachers to teach subjects, without outside coercion.

node.label: Accreditation (education)
node.hasNote: Recognition and approval of the academic standards of an educational institution by some external, impartial body of high public esteem.

node.label: Educational governing boards
node.hasNote: Recognition and approval of the academic standards of an educational institution by some external, impartial body of high public esteem.

node.label: Examination boards
node.hasNote: Recognition and approval of the academic standards of an educational institution by some external, impartial body of high public esteem.

node.label: School supervision
node.hasNote: Recognition and approval of the academic standards of an educational institution by some external, impartial body of high public esteem.

node.label: Academic standards
node.hasNote: Criteria established by an educational institution to determine levels of student achievement.

node.label: Educational accountability
node.hasNote: Criteria established by an educational institution to determine levels of student achievement.

node.label: Educational relevance
node.hasNote: Criteria established by an educational institution to determine levels of student achievement.

node.label: Admission requirements
node.hasNote: Conditions (examination certificates, proof of skills, etc.) of entrance to courses of study, further study, training, etc.

node.label: Adult education programmes
node.hasNote: Programmes designed to provide learning opportunities for both adults who have not had adequate formal education, as well as others interested in lifelong learning.

node.label: Exchange programmes
node.hasNote: Programmes designed to provide learning opportunities for both adults who have not had adequate formal education, as well as others interested in lifelong learning.

node.label: Instructional programmes
node.hasNote: Programmes designed to provide learning opportunities for both adults who have not had adequate formal education, as well as others interested in lifelong learning.

node.label: Literacy programmes
node.hasNote: Programmes designed to provide learning opportunities for both adults who have not had adequate formal education, as well as others interested in lifelong learning.

node.label: Reading programmes
node.hasNote: Programmes designed to provide learning opportunities for both adults who have not had adequate formal education, as well as others interested in lifelong learning.

node.label: Access to education
node.hasNote: Conditions, circumstances or requirements governing admittance to educational institutions or programmes.

node.label: Educational priority areas
node.hasNote: Conditions, circumstances or requirements governing admittance to educational institutions or programmes.

node.label: Universal education
node.hasNote: Conditions, circumstances or requirements governing admittance to educational institutions or programmes.

node.label: Adult education
node.hasNote: The offering of learning opportunities in professional and vocational development, personal development, and social development to adults.

node.label: Mass education
node.hasNote: The offering of learning opportunities in professional and vocational development, personal development, and social development to adults.

node.label: Private education
node.hasNote: The offering of learning opportunities in professional and vocational development, personal development, and social development to adults.

node.label: Public education
node.hasNote: The offering of learning opportunities in professional and vocational development, personal development, and social development to adults.

node.label: Traditional education
node.hasNote: The offering of learning opportunities in professional and vocational development, personal development, and social development to adults.

node.label: Womens education
node.hasNote: The offering of learning opportunities in professional and vocational development, personal development, and social development to adults.

node.label: Activity learning
node.hasNote: Learning by doing.

node.label: Distance education
node.hasNote: Learning by doing.

node.label: Home study
node.hasNote: Learning by doing.

node.label: Independent study
node.hasNote: Learning by doing.

node.label: Practical work (learning method)
node.hasNote: Learning by doing.

node.label: Self instruction
node.hasNote: Learning by doing.

node.label: Study tours
node.hasNote: Learning by doing.

node.label: Verbal learning
node.hasNote: Learning by doing.

node.label: Visual learning
node.hasNote: Learning by doing.

node.label: Acculturation
node.hasNote: Phenomena which result when groups of individuals of different cultures come into continuous contact, with subsequent changes in the original cultural patterns of either or both groups.

node.label: Cultural nationalism
node.hasNote: Phenomena which result when groups of individuals of different cultures come into continuous contact, with subsequent changes in the original cultural patterns of either or both groups.

node.label: Acronyms
node.hasNote: A pronounceable abbreviation of a compound, name or phrase used as one word.

node.label: Ageing population
node.hasNote: Continuing increase of elderly population both in absolute and in proportional terms in a given society.

node.label: Birth rate
node.hasNote: Continuing increase of elderly population both in absolute and in proportional terms in a given society.

node.label: Morbidity
node.hasNote: Continuing increase of elderly population both in absolute and in proportional terms in a given society.

node.label: Mortality
node.hasNote: Continuing increase of elderly population both in absolute and in proportional terms in a given society.

node.label: Nuptiality
node.hasNote: Continuing increase of elderly population both in absolute and in proportional terms in a given society.

node.label: Population decrease
node.hasNote: Continuing increase of elderly population both in absolute and in proportional terms in a given society.

node.label: Population increase
node.hasNote: Continuing increase of elderly population both in absolute and in proportional terms in a given society.

node.label: Population problems
node.hasNote: Continuing increase of elderly population both in absolute and in proportional terms in a given society.

node.label: Accessions lists
node.hasNote: A list of new acquisitions issued periodically.

node.label: Anthologies
node.hasNote: A list of new acquisitions issued periodically.

node.label: Bibliographic journals
node.hasNote: A list of new acquisitions issued periodically.

node.label: Abstracts
node.hasNote: The usually non-critical indication of the subject contents of a document, aiming to permit the user a decision about the relevance of the document.

node.label: Bibliographies
node.hasNote: A list of new acquisitions issued periodically.

node.label: Catalogues
node.hasNote: A list of new acquisitions issued periodically.

node.hasNote: A list of new acquisitions issued periodically.

node.label: Agrarian structure
node.hasNote: A complex of relationships which exist among land tenure, production and supporting services, and related rural institutions, each constituting an integral part of the wider whole.

node.label: Farm size
node.hasNote: A complex of relationships which exist among land tenure, production and supporting services, and related rural institutions, each constituting an integral part of the wider whole.

node.label: Land reclamation
node.hasNote: A complex of relationships which exist among land tenure, production and supporting services, and related rural institutions, each constituting an integral part of the wider whole.

node.label: Land tenure
node.hasNote: A complex of relationships which exist among land tenure, production and supporting services, and related rural institutions, each constituting an integral part of the wider whole.

node.label: Land value
node.hasNote: A complex of relationships which exist among land tenure, production and supporting services, and related rural institutions, each constituting an integral part of the wider whole.

node.label: Agricultural research
node.hasNote: Designed to improve crops, increase yields, develop resistances to diseases.

node.label: Agronomy
node.hasNote: The science of crop and soil management.

node.label: Animal husbandry
node.hasNote: The science of crop and soil management.

node.label: Fisheries
node.hasNote: The science of crop and soil management.

node.label: Food technology
node.hasNote: The science of crop and soil management.

node.label: Forestry
node.hasNote: The science of crop and soil management.

node.label: Agroforestry
node.hasNote: Simultaneous growing of trees with food crops and/or livestock on the same piece of land.

node.label: Forest management
node.hasNote: Simultaneous growing of trees with food crops and/or livestock on the same piece of land.

node.label: Forests
node.hasNote: Simultaneous growing of trees with food crops and/or livestock on the same piece of land.

node.label: Silviculture
node.hasNote: Simultaneous growing of trees with food crops and/or livestock on the same piece of land.

node.label: Agroindustry
node.hasNote: The integration of agricultural production, processing and marketing under a single comprehensive management.

node.label: Dairy industry
node.hasNote: The integration of agricultural production, processing and marketing under a single comprehensive management.
